This tutorial will guide you through the app and will show you how to use it.
 First, your Android version must be lower than Android 11.
 After that, you need to move the CSV files you want to use into the Downloads Directory in the Documents Directory or the Downloads Directory or the Downloads Directory in the SD Card.
 All right, we are ready to continue!
When you open the app, the tutorial screen will show up.\n On the top-left of the screen, there is a navigation menu.
To use the app, you must first create an account. To create an account, please press the icon on the menu that says: "Login/Logout".

If there is a connected account to the app right now, that user will be logged of the app out automatically. Then, a notification will notify you that the user was logged out of the app. After that, press again on this icon.
If you already have an account, log in to your account in this dialog.
If you do not have an account, click the button on the bottom of the dialog. A new dialog will open.

In this dialog, enter your username and password. A valid username can only include English letters, digits, and an underscore(_).
 A Valid username has to include at least one letter and has to begin with a letter or an underscore.
 A valid password can only include English letters, digits, and special characters.
 After filling all the fields in the dialog, click the "Sign Up!" button. If the sign-up process is successful, the dialog will close.
 If the sign-up process fails, a notification will pop up. If your username is invalid, change it to match the valid username pattern I mentioned.
 If your username is taken by someone else, try another one.
 After setting up the account, you are ready to use the app!

If you press on the first item of the menu (the one that says: "Go Home"), the app will redirect you to the tutorial.
 If you press the second item on the menu(the one that says: "Create ML Model"), you will be redirected to the second screen of the app, the main screen. In that screen, you will load your files and create Machine Learning Models. We will discuss about this screen later.
 If you press the third item on the menu(the one that says: "My Models"), you will be redirected to a screen where you will see all your ML Models.
 If you press the fourth item on the menu(the one that says: "My Profile"), a screen with your profile's info will open. On this screen, you will be able to change your username, password, delete your data and even delete your account.
 If you press the fifth item on the menu(the one that says: "Login/Logout"), the login dialog will open.
 If you press the sixth item in the menu(the one that says: "About"), a screen with information about the app will open.

bold.big: Note: You must login to your account to use the app\'s features.

resources.string: Please enter the file\'s name with or without the file extension(.csv) and press \"Load File\".\n There has to be the same amount of items in each row in the file, and there has to be the same amount of rows in each column. All the values in the file must be filled except for one case: If there are empty values in the first row(except for the last value), which is the columns row, the empty values will be labeled as their index in the row. Note: You have to grant the app permission to read files.

Then, choose your X column and Y column and hit \"Start!\".\n When you hit start, the data will be shuffled and divided into training and testing data.\n The model will be built on the training data and tested on the testing data.

After that, the slope and the intercept of the model will show. The app builds a simple 2D linear equation of this form:
 y = m * x + b
 or
 y = slope * x + intercept
 Then, hit "Test My Model!". The model's score on the testing data will appear.
 If the model's score is negative, then the model failed to fit the data.
 After that, hit "Show My Model!". You will be redirected to a screen where your model will be displayed on a graph. If you have too large values(values greater than 100) or too small values(values smaller than -100) in your dataset, the data points from the dataset won't appear on the graph. If there are more than 10 data points in the training data and more than 10 data points in the testing data, only the first ten data points of the training data and the first ten data points of the testing data will appear on the graph.
To leave the graph, click the return button on your phone.
To reset the model building process, hit \"Reset\".
On this screen, you will be able to see all your model. Every model consists of a slope, an intercept, and a score.
To view a model on a graph, click the desired model. On the graph, you will see the linear equation of the model.
To delete a model, click for a second on the model.
